context:
At George Brown College's Continuing Education, individuals can register in and pay for individual courses regardless of whether they are pursuing a credential or not. Registration is typically done on a course-by-course basis, and it is usually not necessary to register for a program before starting a course. Students have the option to take multiple courses within a term if desired. George Brown College provides a range of distance learning courses that allow students to learn from home. The college is located on the traditional territory of the Mississaugas of the Credit First Nation and other Indigenous peoples.

Additional information:
- Students are responsible for verifying George Brown College's fee requirements.
- More information about land acknowledgation can be found on the college-wide website.
- Distance Education FAQ can be accessed to learn more about online learning opportunities.
